p: The transfer of IAVs to new hosts is relatively rare and appears to occur on only a limited number of mammalian hosts, including humans, swine, seals, horses and dogs, as well as poultry. In many other cases influenza viruses are seen to spill over to cause individual infections in a new host with limited capacity for transmission in the new hostâ€“as is seen for H5N1, H7N9 and H10N8 IAVs to name a few [ 8, 36, 37].
